items.title: England intensity was superb from the start - Borthwick
items.summary: England head coach Steve Borthwick was delighted with his side's intensity from the beginning of the match and their defensive quality, during the 48-7 win over Wales in their first match of the Six Nations.

items.title: Team GB skeleton helmet appeal dismissed by Cas
items.summary: The British skeleton team - among Team GB's best hopes for medals at the Winter Olympics - will not be able to wear their new helmets after the Court of Arbitration for Sport said they do not comply with the sport's rules around shape.

items.title: 'Townsend on the ropes after romp in swamp'
items.summary: Arguments for Gregor Townsend remaining as Scotland head coach are growing increasingly small after familiar failings lead to defeat in rainy Rome, writes Tom English.

items.title: 'Townsend on the ropes after romp in swamp'
items.summary: Arguments for Gregor Townsend remaining as Scotland head coach are growing increasingly small after familiar failings lead to defeat in rainy Rome, writes Tom English.

items.title: Yamal scores as Barcelona beat Mallorca to extend lead at top
items.summary: Lamine Yamal scores again as Barcelona beat Mallorca 3-0 to extend their lead at the top of La Liga to four points.

items.title: Arundell scores hat-trick as England heap misery on Wales
items.summary: A remorseless England pile misery and points on Wales as they began their hunt for a first Six Nations title since 2020.

items.title: Arundell scores hat-trick as England heap misery on Wales
items.summary: A remorseless England pile misery and points on Wales as they began their hunt for a first Six Nations title since 2020.

items.title: Boulter seals fourth WTA title with Ostrava Open win
items.summary: Britain's Katie Boulter claims her fourth WTA Tour title with a three-set victory against Tamara Korpatsch at the Ostrava Open on Saturday.

items.title: I believe in what we're doing, says defiant Townsend
items.summary: Head coach Gregor Townsend insists he is still the man to lead Scotland despite a hugely dispiriting defeat by Italy in their Six Nations opener.

items.title: West Ham have to keep believing - Bowen
items.summary: West Ham captain Jarrod Bowen tells Final Score that West Ham have to "keep believing, keep fighting" as they try to escape the Premier League relegation zone.

items.title: Will Vonn do the unthinkable and win Olympic gold?
items.summary: Veteran skier Lindsey Vonn is a "iconic superhuman athlete" and is "risking everything" by racing with an anterior cruciate ligament injury on Sunday, says former Olympic skier Chemmy Alcott.

items.title: Suryakumar rescues India from all-time shock by USA
items.summary: Suryakumar Yadav rescues India from an almighty scare as T20 World Cup co-hosts beat the United States by 29 runs in Mumbai.

items.title: Speed skater's son joins celebrations for Italy's first gold
items.summary: Francesca Lollobrigida celebrates with her young son after winning Italy's first gold medal at this year's Winter Olympics in the women's 3,000m speed skating.

items.title: Holders Swifts, Reds, Coleraine & Larne progress in Irish Cup
items.summary: Holders Dungannon Swifts beat Portadown 2-1 to reach the Irish Cup quarter-finals, while Cliftonville earn a dramatic late win over Glenavon by the same scoreline and Coleraine are extra-time winners over Carrick Rangers.

items.title: Conditions don't excuse Scotland errors - analysis
items.summary: Six Nations pundits John Barclay and Martin Johnson do not believe torrential rain is a valid excuse for the errors Scotland made in their defeat against Italy, as both sides were playing under the same conditions.

items.title: Romero cost Tottenham, not the manager - Sutton

items.title: GB win battle of unbeaten teams to reach mixed semis
items.summary: Team GB's mixed doubles curlers clinched their place in the Winter Olympics semi-finals with two matches to spare, after statement victories over heavyweights Canada and United States maintained their 100% record.
